analyzed: gnas yin zhing gcig la gcig rten pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i ye shes la gnas te gnas 'gyur ba dang / gnas gyur pas ye shes shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / phan tshun bya ba byas par gnas pa dang /
translated: They are mutually established as having performed their function.üîΩIt is the thorough knowledge of the object of knowledge, just as it is.üîΩIt is the thorough knowledge of the seed of liberation of sentient beings who have had beginningless transmigrations.

original: shes bya'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / thog ma med pa'i 'khor dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi thar pa'i sa bon dang mthun pa yongs su shes pa dang / las sna tshogs kyi rnam par smin pa de dang mthun pa yongs su shes pa dang /
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / thog ma med pa'i 'khor dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi thar pa'i sa bon dang mthun pa yongs su shes pa dang / las sna tshogs kyi rnam par smin pa de dang mthun pa yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: It is the thorough knowledge of the ripening of various actions.

original: bdag la phan pa dang gzhan la phan pa dang mthun par yongs su shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du yang tshad med par byed pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la rnam par dpyod pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa dang gzhan la phan pa dang mthun par yongs su shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du yang tshad med par byed pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la rnam par dpyod pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know what is beneficial for oneself and others. It is to make even the smallest roots of virtue immeasurable. It is to analyze what is virtuous and what is not. It is to know the various kinds of arising just as they are.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos 'dzud pa dang 'byin pa dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa la yongs su rtog pa dang / mtha' gnyis spangs nas nang la brten pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos 'dzud pa dang 'byin pa dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa la yongs su rtog pa dang / mtha' gnyis spangs nas nang la brten pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in and to disengage from virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena. It is to understand what is timely and untimely. It is to abandon the two extremes and to rely on the middle way. It is to be diligent in order to be free from the negative actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: gzhan dag kyang bslab pa de nyid la 'god pa dang / bsgom pa la brten na rje su chags pa dang / khong khro ba bor ba dang / 'khor ma @75b rungs pa ma yin pa gdams pa dang / ma nor bar thos pa yongs su btsal ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bslab pa de nyid la 'god pa dang / bsgom pa la brten na rje su chags pa dang / khong khro ba bor ba dang / 'khor ma @75b rungs pa ma yin pa gdams pa dang / ma nor bar thos pa yongs su btsal ba dang /
translated: It is also to establish others in those very trainings, to be loving and to abandon anger, to give instructions to those who are not unruly, to seek out unmistaken listening,

original: chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba dang / bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes nas ji ltar mthun par chos ston pa dang / de kho na khong du chud par bya ba dang / sems la yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa rnam par spong ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba dang / bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes nas ji ltar mthun par chos ston pa dang / de kho na khong du chud par bya ba dang / sems la yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa rnam par spong ba dang /
translated: to gain mastery over all phenomena, to teach the Dharma in accordance with the wishes and latent tendencies of others, to cause them to understand reality, to abandon the grasping of the mind to the real and the unreal,

original: byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa dang / sems can yong su smin par byed pa dang / chos rnams kyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la yongs su rtog pa dang / chos thams cad la mkhas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod pa med pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa dang / sems can yong su smin par byed pa dang / chos rnams kyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la yongs su rtog pa dang / chos thams cad la mkhas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod pa med pa dang /
translated: to complete the accumulations for enlightenment, to ripen sentient beings, to contemplate the arising and destruction of phenomena, to be skilled in all phenomena, and to be without desire for nirvana.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi thob pa dang / chos thams cad la lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes thob pa dang / chos thams cad la the tshom med pa dang / don dam pa'i tshul la 'jug pas mngon par zhen pa med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi thob pa dang / chos thams cad la lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes thob pa dang / chos thams cad la the tshom med pa dang / don dam pa'i tshul la 'jug pas mngon par zhen pa med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: the attainment of the four fearlessnesses, the attainment of spontaneous knowledge of all things, the absence of doubt about all things, and the non-apprehension of the ultimate mode, as previously.

original: ji ltar khong du chud par byed pa'i don de yang rnam pa bcus yongs su bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar khong du chud par byed pa'i don de yang rnam pa bcus yongs su bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the expression of understanding should be known as being taught by ten aspects:

original: 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi lus la rtog pa dang / yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don la rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba chung du dang 'bring dang chen po la rtog pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi lus la rtog pa dang / yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don la rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba chung du dang 'bring dang chen po la rtog pa dang /
translated: the investigation of the compounded and uncompounded bodies of the noble and the non-noble, the investigation of the correct and incorrect meanings, the investigation of the small, middling and great degrees of defilement and purification,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sred pa la rtog pa dang / phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i lta ba la rtog pa dang / sgo sna tshogs nas bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la rtog pa dang / sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pa la rtog pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sred pa la rtog pa dang / phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i lta ba la rtog pa dang / sgo sna tshogs nas bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la rtog pa dang / sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pa la rtog pa dang /
translated: It is to contemplate virtue and nonvirtue. It is to contemplate right and wrong views. It is to contemplate the roots of virtue that are accumulated through various means. It is to contemplate the infinite realms of sentient beings.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin dang / don dang don ma yin pa dang ldan pa la rtog pa dang / mos pa tha dad pa'i sems can la byang chub kyi snying po kun tu ston pa la rtog pas so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin dang / don dang don ma yin pa dang ldan pa la rtog pa dang / mos pa tha dad pa'i sems can la byang chub kyi snying po kun tu ston pa la rtog pas so //
translated: It is to contemplate the meaning of nonattachment as explained above. It is to contemplate the meaning of what is meaningful and what is not meaningful. It is to contemplate the display of the seat of awakening for sentient beings with different kinds of interest.

original: gang gi don du khong du chud par byed pa de yang rnam pa bcus bstan te /
analyzed: gang gi don du khong du chud par byed pa de yang rnam pa bcus bstan te /
translated: The understanding of the meaning for which one strives is also explained in ten ways.

original: sbyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / bzod pa rnam par dag pa dang / brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa dang / bsam gtan rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab rnam par dag pa dang / thabs rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / bzod pa rnam par dag pa dang / brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa dang / bsam gtan rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab rnam par dag pa dang / thabs rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: The ten aspects of the purity of the bodhisattvas' realization are the purity of generosity, the purity of morality, the purity of patience, the purity of effort, the purity of meditation, the purity of wisdom, the purity of means,

original: smon lam rnam pa dag pa dang / stobs rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: smon lam rnam pa dag pa dang / stobs rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes rnam par dag pas so //
translated: the purity of aspiration, the purity of power, and the purity of gnosis.

original: gang du gnas te khong du chud par byed pa de yang rnam pa bcus bstan par rig par bya ste /üîΩsdom pa rnam pa @76a * //
analyzed: gang du gnas te khong du chud par byed pa de yang rnam pa bcus bstan par rig par bya ste / sdom pa rnam pa @76a * //
translated: The ten aspects of the support of the bodhisattvas' realization should be understood as the support of the realization of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe ten aspects of the purity of the bodhisattvas' realization are the purity of the three vows,

original: gsum rnam par dag pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa dang / smad pa dang ma smad pa yongs su spangs pa dang / dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med par mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos dang /
analyzed: gsum rnam par dag pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa dang / smad pa dang ma smad pa yongs su spangs pa dang / dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med par mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos dang /
translated: the abandonment of the apprehension of a self, the abandonment of contempt and lack of contempt, the absence of clinging to things as existent or nonexistent, the absence of clinging to the two vehicles, the absence of clinging to the three realms, the absence of clinging to the three times, the absence of clinging to the three realms, the absence of clinging to the three times, the absence of clinging to the three turnings of the wheel of the Dharma, and the absence of clinging to the three jewels.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa la so sor rtog pa dang / 'dzin pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa la mkhas pas phyin ci ma log pa'i lam ston pa dang / sems can gdul ba'i phyir skye ba thams cad la mi skyo bas so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa la so sor rtog pa dang / 'dzin pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa la mkhas pas phyin ci ma log pa'i lam ston pa dang / sems can gdul ba'i phyir skye ba thams cad la mi skyo bas so //
translated: The bodhisattva's path is distinguished by its lack of conceptual thought about the levels of the solitary realizers and bodhisattvas, by its freedom from all grasping, by its teaching of the unmistaken path through skill in the conventional and the ultimate, and by its never tiring of all births in order to train sentient beings.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa ni mi bslu bas yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa ni mi bslu bas yongs su bstan to //
translated: The practice of the Dharma in accordance with the teachings is shown by its infallibility.

original: yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mngon sum du byed pa dang / de dag la 'dod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mngon sum du byed pa dang / de dag la 'dod pa med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the direct realization of the vehicles of the listeners and solitary realizers, and the absence of any desire for them.

original: yang bdag nyid lam bzang por zhugs pa dang / gzhan dag la yang lam de ston pas so //
analyzed: yang bdag nyid lam bzang por zhugs pa dang / gzhan dag la yang lam de ston pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is the bodhisattva's own entry into the good path and his teaching of that path to others.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rnam par gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rnam par gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: It is the knowledge that is accompanied by the formative factors of existence on the level of earnest aspiration and the gnosis that is free of the formative factors of existence on the path of cultivation.

original: yang shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa dang / mtshan nyid gcig gi rjes su 'jug pas so //
analyzed: yang shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa dang / mtshan nyid gcig gi rjes su 'jug pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is through skill in wisdom and means and through following a single reality.

original: yang gnyis la kun tu spyod pa yongs su spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos bsgom pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams pas so //
analyzed: yang gnyis la kun tu spyod pa yongs su spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos bsgom pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is through the avoidance of conduct in the two and through the practice of the effort to cultivate virtuous qualities.

original: yang chos thams cad legs par bslab pa dang / de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa'i bsgom pa la mkhas pas so //
analyzed: yang chos thams cad legs par bslab pa dang / de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa'i bsgom pa la mkhas pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is through the thorough training in all the teachings and through skill in the cultivation of the realization of thatness.

original: rgyu rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa 'di bzhis 'bras bu rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa 'di bzhis 'bras bu rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the purity of the result is superior through these four aspects of the purity of the cause.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes dus gsum skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes dus gsum skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is the gnosis of the Tathagatas, endowed with the three times in a single instant.

original: ma nor bar bshad de ston pa'i thugs mnyes pas legs par bshad do zhes bya ba'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma nor bar bshad de ston pa'i thugs mnyes pas legs par bshad do zhes bya ba'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: It is explained without error and should be understood to mean that it is well explained, since it pleases the mind of the Teacher.

original: ston pa po rnam par dag pa dang / bstan pa rnam par dag pa dang / bstan pa'i 'bras bu rnam par dag pas mngon par bstod pa'i don rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ston pa po rnam par dag pa dang / bstan pa rnam par dag pa dang / bstan pa'i 'bras bu rnam par dag pas mngon par bstod pa'i don rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the meaning of the praise is that the teacher is pure, the teaching is pure, and the result of the teaching is pure.

original: 'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri zhes bya ba'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri zhes bya ba'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa /
